title: Palentonga
data:
***Obsolete**: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.*

- *This page is about the player [species](/Species "Species"). For the monster, see [Palentonga (monster)](/Palentonga_\(monster\) "Palentonga (monster)").*

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| - | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | The Palentongas are a large, scaled mammalian race, walking on four feet and swinging a powerful tail behind them. Their elephant-back armies terrorize the lands outside the Dungeon.Palentongas are best known for their powerful roll attack, curling up and rolling into a crashing melee attack against nearby foes. They're well suited to melee combat and to casting supportive spells, but they're significantly worse at other forms of combat and advance quite slowly in experience levels. Their body shape reduces the protection given by the body armour they wear. |

## Contents

- [1 Innate Abilities](#Innate_Abilities)
- [2 Preferred Backgrounds](#Preferred_Backgrounds)
- [3 Level Bonuses](#Level_Bonuses)
- [4 Starting Skills and Equipment](#Starting_Skills_and_Equipment)
- [5 Difficulty of Play](#Difficulty_of_Play)
- [6 Skill aptitudes](#Skill_aptitudes)
- [7 History](#History)
- [8 References](#References)

## Innate Abilities

- Palentongas are a hybrid species, with a humanoid torso atop a larger body.

  - **[Deformed](/Deformed "Deformed")**: A Palentonga's hybrid body fits poorly into body armour, granting them only half of the armour's base [AC](/AC "AC").
  - Palentongas get an [EV](/EV "EV") and [Dodging](/Dodging "Dodging") penalty, due to their size.
  - Palentongas cannot wear [boots](/Boots "Boots"), but may equip [bardings](/Barding "Barding").
  - Palentongas are large enough to attack normally while standing in [shallow water](/Shallow_water "Shallow water") (though they still move slowly through it).
  - Palentongas are less encumbered by [shields](/Shields "Shields") than [medium-sized](/Size#medium "Size") races.

- **[Rugged Brown Scales](/Rugged_Brown_Scales "Rugged Brown Scales") 3**: Palentongas are covered in rugged brown scales (AC +3, +7% max HP).

- **[Acute Vision](/Acute_Vision "Acute Vision")**: Palentongas can [see invisible](/See_invisible "See invisible").

- **[Rolling Charge](/Rolling_Charge "Rolling Charge") 1**: Palentongas can perform a rolling charge attack. You must target a non-harmless, hostile monster within 4 tiles.

  - This moves the user up to the target and attacks, taking as long as either one move or one swing (whichever is higher). It bypasses [traps](/Trap "Trap") and other hazards, but not impassible terrain or monsters.
  - Rolling charge deals 33% more damage per tile moved, for a maximum of 2x damage, at 3 tiles[\[1\]](#cite_note-1). It also receives a +5 bonus to [to-hit](/To-hit "To-hit")[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) and creates a soft [noise](/Noise "Noise").
  - [Auxiliary attacks](/Auxiliary_attack "Auxiliary attack") and [cleaving](/Cleaving "Cleaving") still apply when making rolling attacks, but you can't [stab](/Stab "Stab").
  - Rolling charge's range may be improved with any source of [good mutation](/Good_mutation "Good mutation").

- **[Armoured Tail](/Armoured_Tail "Armoured Tail")**: Palentongas have armoured tails that they may use to make especially damaging tail-slap [auxiliary attacks](/Auxiliary_attack "Auxiliary attack").

Palentongas have a base [Strength](/Strength "Strength") of 13, [Intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence") of 8, and [Dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity") of 5 (before [background](/Background "Background") modifiers).

## Preferred Backgrounds

- **Warriors:** [Fighter](/Fighter "Fighter")
- **Zealots:** [Berserker](/Berserker "Berserker"), [Abyssal Knight](/Abyssal_Knight "Abyssal Knight")
- **Warrior-mages:** [Warper](/Warper "Warper")
- **Mages:** [Hedge Wizard](/Hedge_Wizard "Hedge Wizard")

## Level Bonuses

- +1 to a random [stat](/Stat "Stat") every 4th level.
- Average base [HP](/HP "HP") and [MP](/MP "MP").
- +3 [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") per level.
- Gain the [Reflexive Curl](/Reflexive_Curl "Reflexive Curl") mutation at 7th level; when struck, palentongas gain 7 bonus AC until their next turn.

## Starting Skills and Equipment

Palentongas start with all the skills and equipment listed for their background.

## Difficulty of Play

|                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **[Simple](/Category:Easy_species "Category:Easy species")** • [Intermediate](/Category:Moderate_species "Category:Moderate species") • [Advanced](/Category:Hard_species "Category:Hard species") |

Similar to [Hill Orcs](/Hill_Orc "Hill Orc") and [Minotaurs](/Minotaur "Minotaur"), Palentongas are well suited to careers as melee bruisers. They get less AC from their body armour, but their scales, reflexive curl, and the increased protection of bardings helps compensate for that. Rolling Charges can be a powerful opener to combat, but care must be taken to not just charge into the unknown. Still, charging headlong can be useful for certain targets, especially against ranged attackers such as [centaurs](/Centaur_\(monster\) "Centaur (monster)") or creatures that [blink](/Blink "Blink") often.

Their combination of natural scales and deformity also make Palentongas decent spellcasters, with many aptitudes not that far below average.

## Skill aptitudes

The higher the value, the better the aptitude.

|                [Skill](/Skill "Skill")               | [Aptitude](/Aptitude "Aptitude") |             [Skill](/Skill "Skill")             | [Aptitude](/Aptitude "Aptitude") | [Skill](/Skill "Skill")                            | [Aptitude](/Aptitude "Aptitude") |
| :--------------------------------------------------: | :------------------------------: | :---------------------------------------------: | -------------------------------: | -------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------: |
|                     ***Attack***                     |                                  |               ***Miscellaneous***               |                                  | ***Magic***                                        |                                  |
|           [Fighting](/Fighting "Fighting")           |                 0                |            [Armour](/Armour "Armour")           |                               -2 | [Spellcasting](/Spellcasting "Spellcasting")       |                               -1 |
|                                                      |                                  |          [Dodging](/Dodging "Dodging")          |                               -2 |                                                    |                                  |
| [Maces & Flails](/Maces_%26_Flails "Maces & Flails") |                 0                | [Shields](/Shields_\(skill\) "Shields (skill)") |                               -1 | [Conjurations](/Conjurations "Conjurations")       |                               -1 |
|                 [Axes](/Axes "Axes")                 |                 0                | [Stealth](/Stealth_\(skill\) "Stealth (skill)") |                               -3 | [Hexes](/Hexes "Hexes")                            |                                0 |
|           [Polearms](/Polearms "Polearms")           |                -1                |                                                 |                                  | [Summonings](/Summonings "Summonings")             |                               -2 |
|              [Staves](/Staves "Staves")              |                 0                |    [Invocations](/Invocations "Invocations")    |                                1 | [Necromancy](/Necromancy "Necromancy")             |                                0 |
|  [Unarmed Combat](/Unarmed_Combat "Unarmed Combat")  |                 0                |      [Evocations](/Evocations "Evocations")     |                               -1 | [Translocations](/Translocations "Translocations") |                                0 |
|           [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing")           |                -3                | [Shapeshifting](/Shapeshifting "Shapeshifting") |                              N/A | [Alchemy](/Alchemy "Alchemy")                      |                              N/A |
|                                                      |                                  |                                                 |                                  | [Fire Magic](/Fire_Magic "Fire Magic")             |                               -2 |
|     [Short Blades](/Short_Blades "Short Blades")     |                 0                |                                                 |                                  | [Ice Magic](/Ice_Magic "Ice Magic")                |                               -2 |
|       [Long Blades](/Long_Blades "Long Blades")      |                 0                |                                                 |                                  | [Air Magic](/Air_Magic "Air Magic")                |                               -2 |
|  [Ranged Weapons](/Ranged_Weapons "Ranged Weapons")  |                -2                |      [Experience](/Experience "Experience")     |                               -1 | [Earth Magic](/Earth_Magic "Earth Magic")          |                               -1 |

## History

- In [0.30](/0.30 "0.30"), Palentongas were removed, replaced by [Armataurs](/Armataur "Armataur"). Their roll mechanic was transferred into a spell, [Vhi's Electric Charge](/Vhi%27s_Electric_Charge "Vhi's Electric Charge").
- Prior to [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), Rolling Charge was very [noisy](/Noise "Noise"). Palentongas also had base 11 strength (now raised by 2) and a -2 Shields aptitude (raised by 1).
- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), Palentongas had 10% extra HP, in addition to [Rugged Brown Scales](/Rugged_Brown_Scales "Rugged Brown Scales").
- Palentongas were added in [0.26](/0.26 "0.26"), replacing [Centaurs](/Centaur "Centaur").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [melee-attack.cc:1455](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.29.1/crawl-ref/source/melee-attack.cc#L1455) (0.29.1)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [melee-attack.cc:2214](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.29.1/crawl-ref/source/melee-attack.cc#L2214) (0.29.1)

| [Species](/Species "Species") |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| ----------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| Simple                        | [Mountain Dwarf](/Mountain_Dwarf "Mountain Dwarf") • [Minotaur](/Minotaur "Minotaur") • [Merfolk](/Merfolk "Merfolk") • [Gargoyle](/Gargoyle "Gargoyle") • [Draconian](/Draconian "Draconian") • [Troll](/Troll "Troll") • [Deep Elf](/Deep_Elf "Deep Elf") • [Armataur](/Armataur "Armataur") • [Gnoll](/Gnoll "Gnoll") |
| Intermediate                  | [Human](/Human "Human") • [Kobold](/Kobold "Kobold") • [Demonspawn](/Demonspawn "Demonspawn") • [Djinni](/Djinni "Djinni") • [Spriggan](/Spriggan "Spriggan") • [Ghoul](/Ghoul "Ghoul") • [Tengu](/Tengu "Tengu") • [Oni](/Oni "Oni") • [Barachi](/Barachi "Barachi")                                                    |
| Advanced                      | [Coglin](/Coglin "Coglin") • [Vine Stalker](/Vine_Stalker "Vine Stalker") • [Vampire](/Vampire "Vampire") • [Demigod](/Demigod "Demigod") • [Formicid](/Formicid "Formicid") • [Naga](/Naga "Naga") • [Octopode](/Octopode "Octopode") • [Felid](/Felid "Felid") • [Mummy](/Mummy "Mummy")                               |
html:
Palentonga

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.
This page is about the player species. For the monster, see Palentonga (monster).
The Palentongas are a large, scaled mammalian race, walking on four feet and swinging a powerful tail behind them. Their elephant-back armies terrorize the lands outside the Dungeon.

Palentongas are best known for their powerful roll attack, curling up and rolling into a crashing melee attack against nearby foes. They're well suited to melee combat and to casting supportive spells, but they're significantly worse at other forms of combat and advance quite slowly in experience levels. Their body shape reduces the protection given by the body armour they wear.

Contents

  • 1 Innate Abilities
  • 2 Preferred Backgrounds
  • 3 Level Bonuses
  • 4 Starting Skills and Equipment
  • 5 Difficulty of Play
  • 6 Skill aptitudes
  • 7 History
  • 8 References

Innate Abilities

  • Palentongas are a hybrid species, with a humanoid torso atop a larger body.
    • Deformed: A Palentonga's hybrid body fits poorly into body armour, granting them only half of the armour's base AC.
    • Palentongas get an EV and Dodging penalty, due to their size.
    • Palentongas cannot wear boots, but may equip bardings.
    • Palentongas are large enough to attack normally while standing in shallow water (though they still move slowly through it).
    • Palentongas are less encumbered by shields than medium-sized races.
  • Rugged Brown Scales 3: Palentongas are covered in rugged brown scales (AC +3, +7% max HP).
  • Acute Vision: Palentongas can see invisible.
  • Rolling Charge 1: Palentongas can perform a rolling charge attack. You must target a non-harmless, hostile monster within 4 tiles.
    • This moves the user up to the target and attacks, taking as long as either one move or one swing (whichever is higher). It bypasses traps and other hazards, but not impassible terrain or monsters.
    • Rolling charge deals 33% more damage per tile moved, for a maximum of 2x damage, at 3 tiles[1]. It also receives a +5 bonus to to-hit[2] and creates a soft noise.
    • Auxiliary attacks and cleaving still apply when making rolling attacks, but you can't stab.
    • Rolling charge's range may be improved with any source of good mutation.
  • Armoured Tail: Palentongas have armoured tails that they may use to make especially damaging tail-slap auxiliary attacks.

Palentongas have a base Strength of 13, Intelligence of 8, and Dexterity of 5 (before background modifiers).

Preferred Backgrounds

  • Warriors: Fighter
  • Zealots: Berserker, Abyssal Knight
  • Warrior-mages: Warper
  • Mages: Hedge Wizard

Level Bonuses

  • +1 to a random stat every 4th level.
  • Average base HP and MP.
  • +3 willpower per level.
  • Gain the Reflexive Curl mutation at 7th level; when struck, palentongas gain 7 bonus AC until their next turn.

Starting Skills and Equipment

Palentongas start with all the skills and equipment listed for their background.

Difficulty of Play

Simple • Intermediate • Advanced

Similar to Hill Orcs and Minotaurs, Palentongas are well suited to careers as melee bruisers. They get less AC from their body armour, but their scales, reflexive curl, and the increased protection of bardings helps compensate for that. Rolling Charges can be a powerful opener to combat, but care must be taken to not just charge into the unknown. Still, charging headlong can be useful for certain targets, especially against ranged attackers such as centaurs or creatures that blink often.

Their combination of natural scales and deformity also make Palentongas decent spellcasters, with many aptitudes not that far below average.

Skill aptitudes

The higher the value, the better the aptitude.

Skill Aptitude Skill Aptitude Skill Aptitude
Attack Miscellaneous Magic
Fighting 0 Armour -2 Spellcasting -1
Dodging -2
Maces & Flails 0 Shields -1 Conjurations -1
Axes 0 Stealth -3 Hexes 0
Polearms -1 Summonings -2
Staves 0 Invocations 1 Necromancy 0
Unarmed Combat 0 Evocations -1 Translocations 0
Throwing -3 Shapeshifting N/A Alchemy N/A
Fire Magic -2
Short Blades 0 Ice Magic -2
Long Blades 0 Air Magic -2
Ranged Weapons -2 Experience -1 Earth Magic -1

History

  • In 0.30, Palentongas were removed, replaced by Armataurs. Their roll mechanic was transferred into a spell, Vhi's Electric Charge.
  • Prior to 0.29, Rolling Charge was very noisy. Palentongas also had base 11 strength (now raised by 2) and a -2 Shields aptitude (raised by 1).
  • Prior to 0.27, Palentongas had 10% extra HP, in addition to Rugged Brown Scales.
  • Palentongas were added in 0.26, replacing Centaurs.

References

  1. ↑ melee-attack.cc:1455 (0.29.1)
  2. ↑ melee-attack.cc:2214 (0.29.1)
Species
Simple Mountain Dwarf • Minotaur • Merfolk • Gargoyle • Draconian • Troll • Deep Elf • Armataur • Gnoll
Intermediate Human • Kobold • Demonspawn • Djinni • Spriggan • Ghoul • Tengu • Oni • Barachi
Advanced Coglin • Vine Stalker • Vampire • Demigod • Formicid • Naga • Octopode • Felid • Mummy

{{obsolete}}
{{for monster}}
{{flavour|The Palentongas are a large, scaled mammalian race, walking on four feet and swinging a powerful tail behind them. Their elephant-back armies terrorize the lands outside the Dungeon.

Palentongas are best known for their powerful roll attack, curling up and rolling into a crashing melee attack against nearby foes. They're well suited to melee combat and to casting supportive spells, but they're significantly worse at other forms of combat and advance quite slowly in experience levels. Their body shape reduces the protection given by the body armour they wear.}}

==Innate Abilities==
*Palentongas are a hybrid species, with a humanoid torso atop a larger body.
**'''[[Deformed]]''': A Palentonga's hybrid body fits poorly into body armour, granting them only half of the armour's base [[AC]].
**Palentongas get an [[EV]] and [[Dodging]] penalty, due to their size.
**Palentongas cannot wear [[boots]], but may equip [[barding]]s.
**Palentongas are large enough to attack normally while standing in [[shallow water]] (though they still move slowly through it).
**Palentongas are less encumbered by [[shields]] than [[Size#medium|medium-sized]] races.
*'''[[Rugged Brown Scales]] 3''': Palentongas are covered in rugged brown scales (AC +3, +7% max HP).
*'''[[Acute Vision]]''': Palentongas can [[see invisible]].
*'''[[Rolling Charge]] 1''': Palentongas can perform a rolling charge attack. You must target a non-harmless, hostile monster within 4 tiles.
**This moves the user up to the target and attacks, taking as long as either one move or one swing (whichever is higher). It bypasses [[trap]]s and other hazards, but not impassible terrain or monsters.
**Rolling charge deals 33% more damage per tile moved, for a maximum of 2x damage, at 3 tiles<ref>{{source ref|0.29.1|melee-attack.cc|1455}}</ref>. It also receives a +5 bonus to [[to-hit]]<ref>{{source ref|0.29.1|melee-attack.cc|2214}}</ref> and creates a soft [[noise]].
**[[Auxiliary attack]]s and [[cleaving]] still apply when making rolling attacks, but you can't [[stab]].
**Rolling charge's range may be improved with any source of [[good mutation]].
*'''[[Armoured Tail]]''': Palentongas have armoured tails that they may use to make especially damaging tail-slap [[auxiliary attack]]s.

Palentongas have a base [[Strength]] of 13, [[Intelligence]] of 8, and [[Dexterity]] of 5 (before [[background]] modifiers).

==Preferred Backgrounds==
*'''Warriors:''' [[Fighter]]
*'''Zealots:''' [[Berserker]], [[Abyssal Knight]]
*'''Warrior-mages:''' [[Warper]]
*'''Mages:''' [[Hedge Wizard]]

==Level Bonuses==
*+1 to a random [[stat]] every 4th level.
*Average base [[HP]] and [[MP]].
*+3 [[willpower]] per level.
*Gain the [[Reflexive Curl]] mutation at 7th level; when struck, palentongas gain 7 bonus AC until their next turn.

==Starting Skills and Equipment==
Palentongas start with all the skills and equipment listed for their background.

==Difficulty of Play==
{{Easy}}
Similar to [[Hill Orc]]s and [[Minotaur]]s, Palentongas are well suited to careers as melee bruisers. They get less AC from their body armour, but their scales, reflexive curl, and the increased protection of bardings helps compensate for that. Rolling Charges can be a powerful opener to combat, but care must be taken to not just charge into the unknown. Still, charging headlong can be useful for certain targets, especially against ranged attackers such as [[Centaur (monster)|centaur]]s or creatures that [[blink]] often.

Their combination of natural scales and deformity also make Palentongas decent spellcasters, with many aptitudes not that far below average.

{{species_aptitudes|Palentonga}}

==History==
*In [[0.30]], Palentongas were removed, replaced by [[Armataur]]s. Their roll mechanic was transferred into a spell, [[Vhi's Electric Charge]].
*Prior to [[0.29]], Rolling Charge was very [[noise|noisy]]. Palentongas also had base 11 strength (now raised by 2) and a -2 Shields aptitude (raised by 1).
*Prior to [[0.27]], Palentongas had 10% extra HP, in addition to [[Rugged Brown Scales]].
*Palentongas were added in [[0.26]], replacing [[Centaur]]s.
